sentences.english: Alas it is also well known that asynchronous techniques require an inelegant or downright clumsy series of callbacks.
sentences.chinese: 但同时大家也都知道异步技术要求一系列笨重的回调。

sentences.english: We can't move that hulking great desk on our own.
sentences.chinese: 靠我们自己没法搬动那张又大又笨重的办公桌。

sentences.english: The heavy pigs from piggery pulled out is not an easy thing.
sentences.chinese: 把笨重的肥猪从猪圈里拖出来是一件不容易的事。

sentences.english: Flora restored the heavy swivel chair to its upright position.
sentences.chinese: 弗洛拉把那只笨重的转椅扶起来。

sentences.english: Crabbe is quite dense, although he seems to be a little brighter than Goyle.
sentences.chinese: 克拉布是个笨重的家伙，尽管似乎比高尔要聪明一些。

sentences.english: The objects looked cumbersome and ugly. The rabbits were the first to scamper away.
sentences.chinese: 这堆东西笨重而丑陋，小兔子第一个先跳开了。

sentences.english: Soldiers would find that a welcome relief.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们会发现他们从笨重的防护服中终得解脱。

sentences.english: Badgers have heavy bodies, thick skin, short legs, and short tails.
sentences.chinese: 獾的身体笨重，皮肤很厚，脚短尾短。

sentences.english: Before the invention of paper, most Chinese scripts were written on heavy bamboo or wooden slips.
sentences.chinese: 纸发明前，汉字大多写在笨重的竹木简上。

sentences.english: The room was encumbered with heavy furniture.
sentences.chinese: 房内堆满了笨重的家具。

sentences.english: Brower, the grandson, still uses a heavy brass harpoon gun stamped as having been made in a very different whaling capital, New Bedford, Mass.
sentences.chinese: 这位孙子布罗尔先生还在用一根笨重的铜制捕鲸炮。

sentences.english: That makes the EVO, like the HD2, bulkier and heavier than most competitors.
sentences.chinese: 这使得EVO和HD2一样，比多数竞争机型笨重。

sentences.english: A boa constrictor is a very dangerous creature, and an elephant is very cumbersome.
sentences.chinese: 大蟒蛇很危险，大象又十分的笨重。

sentences.english: They were dining off heavy gold-trimmed china.
sentences.chinese: 他们的餐具一色都是笨重的金边瓷器。

sentences.english: Mr. Jackson rose ponderously from the table, and began to look into the cupboards.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊先生笨重的从桌边站起来，开始往壁橱里头看。

sentences.english: He was a heavy man in a tight-fitting yellow and blue uniform .
sentences.chinese: 他笨重的身体紧裹在黄蓝相间的制服里。

definition: obese/bloated/swollen (style)/(fig.) (of an organization) oversized or overstaffed
to entail strenuous effort/to toil at a task/strenuous/laborious/strain
